Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have operating temperatures ranging from as low as 600 degrees C for intermediate temperature operation to above 900 degrees C for higher temperature operation.
Titulo: Energy integration strategies for solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: These high temperatures are often viewed as a considerable disadvantage from a materials point of view because of the occurrence of unwanted interfacial reactions, stresses as a result of thermal expansivity mismatches, etc.
Titulo: Energy integration strategies for solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: However, higher temperatures are also an advantage of SOFC systems.
Titulo: Energy integration strategies for solid oxide fuel cell systems

Titulo: Energy integration strategies for solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: The high operating temperature of an SOFC allows for efficient system energy integration with the waste heat from the fuel cell being used to drive fuel pretreatment processes.
Titulo: Energy integration strategies for solid oxide fuel cell systems

Sentencas: Here, we demonstrate this propensity for energy integration by looking at the use of a novel hydrogen-carrier system working with an SOFC.
